titles.*: Andromeda: Opinionated Micro-services That Scale at a Bank — our journey in platform engineering

en: Moving towards micro-services can, if not careful, lead to chaos: inconsistent practices, unpredictable releases, maintenance burden, and slow velocity. In a highly regulated environment like banking, this chaos isn’t just inconvenient — it becomes a compliance, security, and operational risk.
In this talk we present Andromeda, our opinionated micro-service platform — not just a technical foundation, but a disciplined approach to delivering software safely and consistently at scale.
* What Andromeda is: the tech stack, the runtime model, and the built-in safety rails that shape how teams build, test, deploy, and run micro-services.
* How we do it: the processes, governance, and automated controls that ensure developer autonomy while embedding compliance-by-design — essential for a bank operating under strict regulation.
* Who powers it: the teams, culture, and shared responsibility model that make platform engineering work in practice.

* Why we built it: the challenges of fragmented service landscapes, compliance overhead, and operational inconsistency — and how an opinionated platform helped us regain control and accelerate delivery.
* Where we are now: lessons learned, what worked, what didn’t, and how the platform continues to evolve.

This talk is valuable for anyone building or operating micro-services, especially in regulated or large-scale environments. You’ll get practical insights into how a platform-centric, opinionated approach can create speed, reliability, and compliance — all at the same time.

*: In this practical, end-to-end demo, we’ll walk through the full lifecycle of a Java application running on the Andromeda Platform—from project creation (or certain feature development) to deployment in managed environments.

You’ll see how the platform delivers a streamlined Developer Experience that accelerates delivery through efficient project setup, automated CI/CD pipelines, environment management, built-in observability, and risk-aware change controls.
